content.description: Climb the right side of the face using side-pulls and small edges. Near the top, move a little to the right before traversing back to the left, following a slanting finger crack.
content.location: Starts a bit to the right of Uncertainty.

content.description: Easy face climb up to a little overhang, where it gets a little tricky. The first bolt is pretty high, but climbing to it is very easy.
content.location: Farthest left on the east facing wall. Across the gully from Brown-Eyed Girl.

content.description: Directly to the right of Brown-Eyed Girl, this climb is very similar to its sister to the left. A little bit steeper, but there are some great slope holds and plenty of jugs.
content.location: Directly to the right of Brown-Eyed Girl. Starts to the right of the crack.

content.description: Super easy crack climb. You can use some off width technique or just face climb around. Maybe 5.7 if you only use the crack. You can use the anchors at the top of brown eyed girl. This would be a good first trad lead.
content.protection: big gear mostly. would take up to a #5
content.location: Right between brown eyed girl and tendonitis be damned.

content.description: Climb the middle of the face on the dark gray rock, just to the right of Uncertainty
content.location: Just to the right of Uncertainty

content.description: Very easy, fun, straightforward climb. A Great first lead. Climb the dark, west facing, wall starting to the left of the crack. There is a slight variation of this climb, where you can start farther to the left of the crack, in a little bowl and climb the slightly overhung wall, then traversing over to the bolts.
content.location: Black face starting to the left of the crack.
